examples: She enjoyed the juicy sweetness of raspberries, an aggregate fruit.

examples: It had no appreciable impact on the election.

And so you actually have the material that's not in the core being shot out of the star at appreciable percentages of the actual speed of light.

But when that does happen, when the last star dies, it means that the only objects left in the Universe generating appreciable energy will be the corpses of stars: white dwarfs, neutron stars, and black holes.
words.defineEn: (of a change or amount) important or noticeable

examples: The concept of a kid's mental age is essentially the level of performance associated with a certain chronological age.

words.defineEn: organized according to the order that the events occurred in

examples: We saw commensurate crackdown on other alternative political parties.

words.defineEn: suitable in comparison to something else, like quality, extent, size, etc.
